intro: Draba oederi, commonly known as Oeder's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This low-growing perennial typically forms dense mats of foliage and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Draba oederi thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing in soil that is poor in nutrients. Its ability to survive in harsh climates makes it an important component of polar ecosystems.
